name: Southern African Music
description: Encompasses Southern African Folk Music and more modern genres, consisting in a specific style of a worldwide popular genre mixed with or rooted in a local traditional folk genre, through South Africa, Lesotho, Botswana, Eswatini, Namibia, southern Angola, and Matabeleland region in southern Zimbabwe.

children.name: Amapiano
children.description: House from South Africa deriving from previous popular genres including Gqom, Kwaito, and Deep House.

children.name: Bulawayo Jazz
children.description: Emerged from the city of Bulawayo, Zimbabwe in the early 1950s, led by the alto sax and accompanied by ensembles.

children.name: Cape Jazz
children.description: Developed parallel to American Jazz in the early 20th century, named for its origin in Cape Town, South Africa.

children.name: Famo
children.description: Popular and danceable style from Lesotho and the surrounding Sotho-speaking region of South Africa, often featuring the accordion as the lead instrument.

children.name: Gqom
children.description: Evolved from South African House, specifically Kwaito; often described as a more minimal and raw version.

children.name: Isicathamiya
children.description: A cappella Zulu style, which takes a softer, more melodious approach, in contrast to the powerful, loud sound of the earlier Mbube style.

children.name: Jit
children.description: Guitar-driven electric pop from Zimbabwe that draws influence from Central and East African rumba, South African jive and local music.

children.name: Kwaito
children.description: Emerged from South Africa in the early 1990s, taking influence from Disco and Hip Hop.

children.name: Marabi
children.description: South African Jazz with origins in the 1920s and rooted in traditional South African music.

children.name: Maskandi
children.description: Zulu style of music usually led by a fingerpicked acoustic guitar.

children.name: Mbube
children.description: A cappella Zulu genre, performed in a powerful and loud manner by an all-male choir.

children.name: Motswako
children.description: Mainly rapped in a mixture of Setswana and English, incorporating additional languages and local South African and Botswanan influences, particularly Kwaito.

children.name: Shangaan Electro
children.description: South African genre with very fast BPM (around 180) featuring MIDI keyboard sounds and marimba.

children.name: Shona Music
children.description: Music of the Shona people, a Bantu ethnic group who form a majority population in Zimbabwe.

children.name: Southern African Folk Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of southern Africa.

children.name: Sungura
children.description: Zimbabwean style combining the guitar work of Soukous with the speed and texture of Benga and the strong bass of Township Jive.

children.name: Township Bubblegum
children.description: Synth-heavy Dance-Pop style popular in the South African townships in the 1980s and early 1990s.

children.name: Township Jive
children.description: Originating in the townships of South Africa, similar to Mbaqanga but bringing in Western pop elements.

children.name: Tsonga Disco
children.description: Drum machines, synthesizers, and male vocals backed by a female choir, singing in a call and response style.
